pages.md:
# The Mode Dial To select a shooting mode, rotate the dial until the icon for the desired mode aligns with the index. !Mode Dial | Mode | Description | Page | |-----------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------| | ① **AUTO (AUTO)** | The camera automatically optimizes settings to the scene. You also have the option of choosing the desired scene mode yourself. | 48 | | ② **P (PROGRAM AE)** | Aperture and shutter speed can be adjusted using program shift. | 71 | | ③ **S (SHUTTER PRIORITY AE)**
**A (APERTURE PRIORITY AE)**
**M (MANUAL)** | Select for full control over camera settings, including aperture (**M** and **A**) and/or shutter speed (**M** and **S**). | 73
75
77 | | ④ **C1/C2/C3/C4 (CUSTOM 1/2/3/4)** | Take pictures using previously-stored settings. | 82 | | ⑤ **FILTER (FILTER)** | Take photos with filter effects. | 81 | | ⑥ **(MOVIE)** | Record movies. | 57 | | ⑦ **Vlog (Video blog)** | Record movies at settings suitable for vlogs (video blogs). | 58 |

items.value:
To select a shooting mode, rotate the dial until the icon for the desired mode aligns with the index.

!Mode Dial
items.md:
To select a shooting mode, rotate the dial until the icon for the desired mode aligns with the index.

!Mode Dial

rows: The camera automatically optimizes settings to the scene. You also have the option of choosing the desired scene mode yourself.
Aperture and shutter speed can be adjusted using program shift.
Select for full control over camera settings, including aperture (**M** and **A**) and/or shutter speed (**M** and **S**).
Record movies at settings suitable for vlogs (video blogs).
